channel.title: current account on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in current account on FinanClub

item.title: New Zealand Current Account Deficit Narrows
item.description: New Zealand’s annual current account deficit narrowed in the first quarter of 2023, from 9% of gross domestic product (GDP) to 8.5%. The narrowing of the deficit was due to a number of factors, including the return of tourists and international students following the pandemic, which boosted services exports.

item.title: South African Current-Account Deficit Narrows More Than Expected
item.description: South Africa’s Current-Account Deficit Narrows South Africa’s current-account deficit narrowed to 2.2% of gross domestic product (GDP) in the first quarter of 2023, from 3.2% in the fourth quarter of 2022. The narrowing of the deficit was driven by a decline in imports, which fell by 10.
